intro: Hieracium caesium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as fruits. Hieracium caesium is often found in sunny, open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
